New Remote

April 11th, 2006 · 1 Comment

I bought a new, super remote to replace my Sony touchscreen remote.Â  The Sony did what I wanted but had to be laboriously programmed by hand for each device and was difficult to use by feel.Â  When it lost all of its programming when the batteries went dead, I basically threw it in the junk pile and just did things by hand that couldn’t be done with the Tivo’s remote.

So I got my new Logitech Harmony 550 remote on Monday.Â  This remote is USB programmable and the Logitech website supposedly has tens of thousands of devices in its database.Â  I initially ran into problems when I tried to install the software to program the remote - usually I ignore CDs that come with the device and just download the latest software from the support website.Â  In this case, that led to a horrible usability experience (why do websites still not work with mozilla/firefox???) and software which didn’t connect to the remote.Â  So I tried installing the software off the CD and it worked the first time.

Once the software was installed, I just told it the model numbers of the devices in my system and it programmed the remote with four frequent “activities” which it can control (Watch Tivo, Watch DVD, Listen to Radio,Â  Listen to CDs).Â  Basically now I just hit “Watch Tivo” and it sets up all the devices to that purpose.Â  In practice it seems to work really well.Â  The Tivo settings did not include key mappings for several keys I use all the time so I got to go into the more arcane areas to fine tune the button selection.Â  This too worked flawlessly and now the remote does everything I want - no more getting up off the couch!

  • 1 Olly // Apr 20, 2006 at 4:58 pm

    I got a Harmony 525 a couple of weeks ago after I got fed up of juggling five different remotes and it’s awesome, a real godsend. It took me a lot of tweaking to get it working exactly how I wanted but it’s so much easier to program than any other universal remotes I’ve used. I definitely recommend them.
